alert.note: Alert for Coke (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 9:38PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coke, northeastern Tom Green, southwestern Runnels and northwestern Concho Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 937 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Orient, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Tennyson around 950 PM CDT. Maverick around 1015 PM CDT. Ballinger around 1035 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Harriet, Ballinger Lake and The Intersection Of Ranch Road 380 And Ranch Road 381. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
